Alanna Fields (b.1990) bụ  America na-ese ihe na ónyé na-edebe ihe ichié nké bi na Brooklyn, New York.
A mụrụ Fields ná Upper Marlboro, Maryland, nà 1990. O nwèrè BA na Literature na Mahadum Trinity Washington, ma gaa Pratt Institute, gụsịrị akwụkwọ na mmemme Photography MFA na 2019.

Fields na-eji ihe ncheta n'ọrụ ya iji chọpụta otú e si nọchite ányá ndị Black queer n'akụkọ ihe méré eme.  Ọrụ ya na-eji foto, ederede na eserese, ma na-ejikarị wax eme ihe iji gosipụta ụzọ e si eme ka ahụ ndị Black na akụkọ ihe méré eme ghara ịdị. O gosipụtara na Museum of Contemporary African Diasporan Art, na mmemme Photoville nke Brooklyn.  A na-edebe ọrụ ya na nchịkọta ọha na eze nke Prince George Azs African American Museum and Cultural Center. N'afọ 2021, New York Times Style Magazine nyèrè ya ọrụ ịmepụta ọrụ gbasara mmetụta nke ọrịa a na-efe efe na ọbụbụenyi. Ọ bụ otu n'ime ndị na-ese ihe na 2021-22 na Silver Art Projects na New York.  Fields na-anọchite anya ụlọ ọrụ na ụlọ ọrụ Assembly.
N'afọ 2018, ọ natara Gordon Parks Scholar Award, ọ bụkwa ónyé na-ese ihe na 2020 Light Work Artist in Residence.
